subject: Programming
title: Undecidable Problems
description: A fast breakdown of Undecidable Problems for builders.

hook.text: Some questions sound simple but no computer can ever answer them. Not today, not in a trillion years.

buildup.text: The halting problem asks: will this program finish or loop forever? Turing proved it's undecidable.

discovery.text: Undecidable means no algorithm exists â€” not that we haven't found one, but that none can exist.

twist.text: Virus detection is related: perfectly identifying all malware is equivalent to the halting problem.

climax.text: Computers have hard limits. There are questions that math itself says cannot be answered by machines.

punchline.text: Some problems are unsolvable by any machine, ever.

quiz.question: What does 'undecidable' mean in computer science?
options: No algorithm can ever solve it
